title: I am concerned I've been scammed - Rebtel, can you fix this?
text: I've just signed up for Rebtel.  When I looked at the rates on line, they said it was 4.9cents a minute to call France.  I down loaded the app, and used my credit card to buy $4.90 or 100 minutes as stated on the website, but when I asked for a rate through the app, it said 17 cents per minute.  That is significantly higher and not acceptable!  I entered my credit card information twice, and it is still not showing my purchase of $4.90 (or possibly $9.80).  Rebtel, please show you are reputable and help me through this.  Thanks!
answer: Dear Heather,When you purchase a deal the amount paid is not reflected on the balance of money you have on your Rebtel account, but under "Deals and bonuses". Just log on to your account on my.rebtel.com and you will see under “Deals & Bonuses” the amount of minutes you have left for any purchased deal.The rate displayed by default is our regular rate, but it is not the rate applied for your calls with the deal minutes.When you purchase a deal, you receive a certain amount of minutes (100 minutes for your deal). If you divide the deal price on the amount of minutes, you will have the correct rate for your calls with the deal.I hope this clears up things!

title: The CATCH or SCAM with RebTel…(?)
text: A long-time, one-time RebTel fan, I recently became aware of how RebTel offers such low rates: 1) your minutes start when the call/ringing begins — not upon an actual connection, 2) it *simply* rings regardless of what is happening in the destination country (busy, error message, etc), and 3) I've even heard that after ringing constantly for over a minute (if left ringing it tries twice during a single call), the receiving party only got the last few rings(!). This is a real problem and questionable technique… dare I say "scam." I'm already paying a local rate every time a call is initiated without connection using a local number during this erroneous ringing period — why should we also pay an international FOR NO CONNECTION? Curious how many of you have been experiencing this, but did not know.

title: Rebtel and Privacy?! Quality?
text: I am an living in the US, using Rebtel for more than 2 years.I got an email from Rebtel yesterday, congratulating the Islamic Eid after Ramadan!I was really shocked to see that Rebtel has categorized me as a Muslim and is spying on my contacts! This is a very big marketing mistake for them! Rebtel is a telecom. company, and should not in any way involves the religious belief of customers in their marketing strategy. Rebtel SHOULD NOT spy on my contact lists! I am looking to replace Rebtel with something else due to these facts:- Bridge of my privacy and categorizing me as a 6-cylinder Muslim while I have no religious affiliation.- The quality is very very BAD for the first time connections. You have to re-call to get a better quality. In this way, they can charge more minutes! - I am not sure if they sell consumers data to NSA etc etc! What if I go under the surveillance of NSA etc etc because you Rebtel guys put me in practicing Muslim lists. If Rebtel does not provide any satisfactory explanation for me, I will definitely go after them both legally and on the net. I warn everyone about these serious issues.------This is my response to Rebtel team's response:------------------ Dear Rebtel Team,Religion is a very sensitive issue! PLEASE DO NOT use it for marketing purposes! You should be aware that in those countries, there are a large group of minorities who are suffering from religious related discrimination and violations!Let me give you an example to make the case clear if it is hard for you to understand my point: - Your job is to connect people in the best way! Not to congratulate the birth day of Muhammed, Moses or Jesus, based on the stereotypes! What about sending an email to Neo-Nazis congratulating Hitler's birthday, and having some Holocaust survivors in the that mailing list, too! Are you guys sending a Merry Christmas message to Christian minorities in these Islamic countries. Of course not!In short, you guys should not be identifying your diverse body of customers based on their religions!!! That is like labeling people! In all of those countries you named there are tens of non-Islamic religions. I might have called some of those countries that you named but this is my business and NOT YOUR business to track my calling list and put me in your "Muslim Box"! What if I call India another day: Am I a Hindu or Buddhist or Muslim or Christian or ...?!!! That is ridiculous! This is exactly what NSA programs are doing! Checking who is calling whom and how long and then label them! And they will be very pleased to know that you guys have reduced their work load with your religion boxes with the names of costumers!! Being at any points of the world, does not give you any immunity from NSA or other agencies! Are suggesting you guys have a better security than Google and Yahoo and Apple ;) By the way, are 100% of people in Sweden Christian and love Jesus and go to Church!? Of course not! So, that is non-sense to get religious messages involved in the business, specially cherry-picking for Muslims.
answer: Hi Alex,Thank you for your feedback. As you may be aware, people around the world use Rebtel to keep in touch with their friends and family. Our users are incredibly diverse and we try to celebrate all major festivals, be it Eid, Christmas, Diwali or Hanukkah. We would like to assure you that we do not categorize our users by religion. The Ramadan email was sent to Rebtel users that either live in or call countries such as Pakistan, Saudi Arabia, Indonesia, Egypt etc. If you don’t live in or call one of these countries, then we would like to apologize to you. We take your privacy very seriously and never share your information, especially the NSA, as we are based in Sweden. Feel free to contact us at support@rebtel.com if you would like to know more.Best regards,The Rebtel Team

The call quality was poor & kept dropping. When I arrived home I found that Rebtel had diverted the call to my provider and I am now stuck with large call charges, made even higher because the call kept dropping. I contacted Customer services almost 10 times in over 2 weeks but they will not  respond. Avoid them at all costs or they could cost you huge amounts of money.Their mission statement states that they want to provide 'the first genuinely good, honest, and trustworthy global mobile telecommunications service that saves people money'. They have failed on every count. My original review was challenged by Rebtel within 2 days and has been suspended for review, yet their Customer Service department has still not contacted me. Unless you want to risk a similar experience I would strongly recommend avoiding this company.

title: its like talking to someone while wearing earplugs
text: I've been using rebtel to call my girlfriend in Cambodia for about 3 weeks now. Sure, rebtel rates are fairly cheap but is it really worth it when both of us cannot make out what the other person is saying? We're constantly asking each other to repeat themselves because it's so muffled. We usually end our conversations more frustrated than anything because it's extremely annoying to have to repeat yourself over and over again. Also, there's a feature on the mobile app for collect SMS. Meaning the other person can text you and it will charge you. At least the SMS go through well, right? Well.. yes and no. I was ecstatic to find out that I can pay for her SMS sent to me because being in the Peace Corps, she's limited financially. I turned on the feature and let her know that she can text me freely because she does not have to pay for it. But did it charge me? Nope. Did it charge her? Yes.Rebtel has given me the worst emotional blue balls a phone service can possibly give to a person. Teasing me with the idea that I can talk to my significant other freely but turning around and slapping me in the face with horrible call quality and dysfunctional features.

text: They have a promotion to call to Cuba in which they double the minutes when making a deposit, in this case I deposit for $25 and suposed to receive 50 minutes, but I was calling to Cuba and conection is harder than calling to any other place. After few attempts my call finally when thru, but I noticed the time remaning was shorter and when checking the calls time I saw they count the unsuccessful intents a part of the time within the promotion, not just that but if your firsts call fail and it last for 1:03 that counts for 2:00 minutes, because this is the way they do it according to a representative called Fernando who took care of my complaint. In resume be aware that you will not enjoy the full minutes indicated as they say.

title: A very cheap and reliable way to connect to family abroad.

To make call without connecting first to either local or internet.2. Making free call to your friends that are also using Rebtel need to be improve upon. I've tried many times to call friends free but this has not being working. But all in all, i think Rebtel is still better compare to other international providers.
answer: Hi Adebeso,Happy you like the app and still have suggestions could you send us a email at support@rebtel.com. Please mark the email by saying Sacha ask you to contact and they will direct you to me :)Sacha

title: Rebtel is a wonderful, efficient and inexpensive way to make international calls
text: I have searched a long time for a phone card or other subscription that would enable me to make cheap international calls, and at last I have found one in Rebtel. There are no frills, no gimmicks, just a fast-working method that brings me in contact with loved ones in New Zealand, the USA and elsewhere by dialing a special number. I am amazed at how cheap it is--I initially bought for ten dollars and still have almost five dollars left, after 10-12 calls each lasting more than ten minutes and some up to forty. I don't know how Rebtel does it, but I have just bought more time!

title: Access number unavialable!
text: I've been using Rebtel for over two years now and largely the service is convenient and competitive on pricing. However my issue is with custmer service, if you ever run into technical difficulties, you can not speak to anyone, you have to send off an email and wait until someone gets back to you. The access number in Toronto has been unavailable for a couple of hours now and there is absolutely nothing I can do about it but wait for Rebtel to respond to me in their own sweet time. Does not work for me! Time to look for an alternative service.
answer: Hi Eyi,We do not have a number where you can contact us but we offer Chat service. When our agents are available for Chat you will see the tab on the right bottom corner. Otherwise we get back to you via e-mail as soon as we can.I am sorry for the problem you experienced with our service in Toronto, it was indeed a glitch that was solved completely next day. Whenever there are big disruptions on our service we publish it in our Help Center: http://www.rebtel.com/en/Get-Help/Zendesk/Our apologies for any inconvenience caused!

title: Fraudulent company that fraudulently bills your account for transactions that you didnt make.
text: I was reviewing my account and found out that I had been billed $50 by Rebtel without a corresponding e mail from Rebtel. I contacted my bank and informed them that this was a fraudulent billing. When my bank contacted Rebtel their response was to shut down my account and then had the audacity to tell me that I must inform my bank to release the hold. They then proceeded to tell me that it must have been a mistake from my bank. That was rubbish. I had been using Rebtel for approximately three to five years and spend approximately $200 to $500 per month on their services. My service was temporarily restored and after they were queried by my bank, they could not justify the charge the charge was reversed. Now they have Interrupted my account and shut it down. I am going to open a face book page and urge people to BOYCOTT REBTEL. I have been instrumental in getting many of my friends turned on to Rebtel. Now I am going to have to tell them about this experience. I had hitherto suspected that Rebtel was making fraudulent charges to my account without the corresponding credits being given and this time I caught them red handed. I have also had an exerience of where my account was being advanced charged for replenishment even though I had not selected that option. REBTEL SUCKS  BIG TIME AND I INTEND TO LET THE WORLD KNOW ABOUT THIS.
answer: Hi Alieu!My name is Daniel, I am part of the Support team of Rebtel, and I would like to help you with this matter.Could you send me an email to my attention on support@rebtel.com?I will make sure to clear up this situation for you so you can continue using our service.Thanks in advance for your feedback!DanielRebtel Customer Team

title: Unstable performance, very bad customer service, security concerns
text: I've lived in South & North America for some time; have had a chance to use Rebtel for 6 month or so. First, let me talk about their SMS service. It sucks! I'm not sure how the system selects on what phone number to assign an SMS icon, most of the time the icon does not appear next to the contact that was added, and an e-mail to the customer service has to be sent, and their reply which will take days to say "we have received your e-mail" and then another days to say, it has been fixed. Which I don't have time to wait for, all these in days?? Even when you sent an SMS, it gets delayed almost 90% of the time, and Rebtel always blames the 3rd world countries or the developing countries Telecommunication service, which I have hard time to believe when I can send an sms to 3 different people leaving in the same city/region and radius, only 1 will get the sms in minutes, while the others gets it in hours or even days later. Are you kidding me Rebtel???The phone service is acceptable considering, occasionally a network problem which can happen with all VIP phones; however whenever I added minutes almost all the time, I won't see my added minutes or balance for another 10-20 minutes, and that is a time I can't afford to lose, since most calls are made overseas and there are time zone concerns and etc...so timing is very important to me, which I never got from Rebtel till the end. I have had a handful of dropped calls while calling different parts of the world; I was given a credit for some, which is of course after complaining. Due to all my experiences,  I did not feel comfortable leaving my CC information saved there during that 6 month I was using.Now as I write this, my account has been blocked for unknown reason, it's still locked and I'm tired of going back and forth with their inconsistent customer service I was forced to abandon my account and look for other service elsewhere.
answer: Hi, We are sorry to hear that and we understand your frustration over our service.Please send us an e-mail to support@rebtel.com with a note "To Walid" and we can assure you that we will do our best to assist you.Walid.Rebtel Customer Team.

title: PER MINUTE BILLING TOO HIGH
text: Before Rebtel, i bought phone cards to call Nigeria. Each phone card of $2.50 would give me about 30minutes calling nigeria Mobile phones, which means that a $10 worth of card should give me 2 hours of talk time.With Rebtel option, i pay 8.4c per minute calling the same Mobile lines, which would translate to about 11.90 minutes for a $10 worth of Rebtel air-time.So you tell me, what advantage am i getting from switching to Rebtel?To stay more competitive, you would need to do a competitive analysis with a view to reducing fees further.
answer: Hi Peter,We're constantly working with our suppliers in Nigeria to lower the rates while still maintaining our excellent call quality.We suggest you to read the small prints behind the cards; they often have hidden costs, such as maintenance and connection fees. It is common knowledge that calling cards deliver only 60 per cent of their promised minutes.However, Rebtel has no hidden fees and we are always working to reduce and review our rates, just keep an eye in our website and newsletters so you take advantage of our offers and rate reductions to Nigeria!

title: wow!
text: It's so nice to get a number in Amsterdam for each person I want to call abroad. I can use my landline for that with unlimited calls to landlines in the Netherlands. I can also use my mobile with 800 minutes for landllines and mobile lines in the Netherlands for that. I don't have to be online after I have purchased credit for my Rebtel account. The fees for several countries are great. India is cheaper than ever. I used to have €0,015 as the smallest fee and several times I paid €0,02 to €0,03/minute. Now only €0,008 and only when the line is answered. Ghana and Mali have competetive prices. They can't still be cheap as €0,07 would be. But they are just below €0,15 and that's quite a standard price for other cheap ways of calling those countries. Rebtel has managed to keep their prices a little below that price of €0,15 which I consider a great accomplishment.Uganda and Kenya and even Pakistan are relatively cheap at €0,07 app. Very happy about that.Sending an sms must be done on the website. However you can type fast as you can use a normal keyboard which isn't possible on a handy. Sms's are cheap. I would have to pay €0,55 for sending an sms to India with my mobile phone provider. Now with Rebtel it costs €0,02. I also get to see when the sms is delivered. Great! I can see exactly how long it took for the sms to be delivered. I can also allow the other person to call me back or sms me back at my cost. Best of all: I don't have to pay incase the other person doesn't answer the phone. Incase I would use a cheap service number (0900 numbers) in the Netherlands for which I can call India for €0,02 I would still have to pay for the 1 minute and 25 seconds I was trying to reach him. That is rounded to 2 minutes so it would cost me €0,04 in total. If I would do that multiples times (as I have done at times) I am still spending a lot of money.On the downside: I can't let somebody call me back or sms me back for free incase they don't have a working internet connection on their mobile phone. They might not have a subscription for internet or their bundle might have finished or they might not have purchased internet as they might not have enough money for that. In all of these cases they can't just simply call me back at my cost. That's different with a Collect Call. An operator will ask permission and will connect the other person to me at my cost. It is expensive of course but it works. Now however people can only respond incase they can access the internet. It would have been nice if the system recognizes that I have used Rebtel for sending the sms or for calling them so that the system automatically will deduct the collect call fees for a call or sms of my Rebtel account.Keep going!

title: Mainly great service, but some sneaky charges turned me off
text: I was excited by Rebtel when it was first recommended to me by a friend, and I've used it several times with success. However, in a recent experience, I called someone, they didn't answer, but then they called back using the Rebtel numbers, and unknowingly I somehow "accepted" a collect call. Because I believed the rate to be 1.5 cents per minute, I talked for 30 minutes, only to find my account charged for close to $9. Apparently a small noise made at the beginning of my call was supposed to alert me that I was getting charged at this absurdly high rate. I think it's abusive of Rebtel to believe anyone could figure that out. I promptly went into my settings and changed my alert for receiving collect calls - I suggest all other users do the same. But I am now much more hesitant to use Rebtel due to fear of other hidden charges.
answer: Hi Jessica,You can change in your settings if you want to accept collect calls or to be asked in advance if you accept the charges, is good that you found already those settings and changed them. Since a collect call is an incoming call, we will charge the rate of your own country and not the rate for the country where you are receiving the call from. We regret any confusion about this, you can read about how our collect calls work in our FAQ: http://www.rebtel.com/en/Get-Help/faq/Making-Calls/What-is-a-Collect-Call/#What-is-a-Collect-CallWe do not have any hidden costs.Sorry for any confusion caused!

title: No Sound
text: Lately, the rate to call Japan was raised from 2 cents to 7 cents - 3 times higher. Yet, the quality became worse. On my recent call to Japan, I was able to hear my mother on the other end, but she did not hear me at all, so she hung up - 7 cents for this. Both of us could hear each other on the 2nd call. Then my phone lost battery, so the call was terminated, and I called again. Same as the 1st call - my mother did not hear me - another 7 cents for nothing. I called back and it worked okay for a while, but my balance was getting low, so I added funds ($10) during the call. Guess what? The call was ended by Rebtel when the balance dropped to $10.03. Yes, there were beeps and notifications, and also automated operator was asking me to add funds. I already added funds online, so I did not add more funds on the phone. I switched from Google Voice due to the fact I had to close my Google accout. Rebtel calls worked better at the same rate of 2 cents a minute as Google Voice, before the rate went up to 7 cents. It does not make sense to me.
answer: Hi Kazuyo,We regret the quality issues you experienced. We would love to assist you, so we will appreciate if you send us an e-mail to support@rebtel.comPlease write in the subject of your mail At'n Veronica so I can identify your ticket.Thanks in advance for your cooperation!

answer: Hi Raman,Please write us at support@rebtel.com, give us the number registered on your account and a brief description of the problem with your calls. We will be happy to assist you!As per the mixed up numbers, we recommend that you register the numbers you want to call from in the same Rebtel account, you can add up to 5 different numbers.The local numbers we assign for the calls are so called shared numbers, this means that they are the same for any user living on your same area code.  But each local number that is generated on your contacts list will be linked to the number you call from and to the international number of your friend.I hope this information is helpful, if you require further assistance please contact us at support@rebtel.comThanks for your cooperation!

title: FRUSTRATING!
text: My account has been blocked now by Rebtel for days as I tried to log in from a VPN. Although I have had so far courteous service from Customer Services, this problem was logged 3 days ago and nothing has been done since.  This is deeply frustrating as I need access to a VOIP/sms serviceI have uninstalled the Rebtel App from my android phone as I consider that neither Rebtel nor google nor anyone else needs to have access to my private contact list nor any other private data. I think the ubiquitous collecting of data by suc services as Google, Microsoft, Facebook and now Rebtel  should be of great cocern to everyone but most do not think about the consequences.  I do nd am not prepared to give up control of my personal data to anyone un-necessarily.  I have paid to use this service and as far as I am concerned Rebtel should only require the information needed to administer the account and payment,  I wish to continues to use this service but I will only consider using Rebtel's web page based services.  If it refuses to unlock my account then I will have to ask for a refund and fnd another provider that will provide a service to me that is not so intrusive and controlling.
answer: Hi Dominic,Our security threshold is set high in order to avoid any misuse and protect our users from any fraudulent activity. We do understand it might be inconvenient for good customers like you, we are therefore working on a better way to keep our loyal users from getting locked. I have unlocked now your Rebtel account and made some changes that hopefully will prevent your account from getting locked next time you use your VPN. Regarding your address book: Rebtel needs access to your contact list in your address book to find out which of your contacts you can call for free. We only use this information to connect free calls between you and your friends and to be able to notify you when friends in your address book sign up for Rebtel and you can call them for free. This information will never be shared with any third-parties, sold, or misused in any way.I hope you find this information useful!Warm Regards,Rebtel Customer Team

title: Why deduct money even cannot connect: its happening frequently
text: I tried to connect; its telling funny message; "other party is not online" and just deducting money--doing it repeatedly--very bad--I am extremely disappointed for last couple of days
answer: Dear Shaikh,The problem you are referring to, i.e. where a call is charged even though it is not connected is a common problem in the telecom business. This makes us as frustrated as you. We hate that it hurts you as our customer and we hate that it scams us. A provider down the line of connecting your call is sending us a signal saying that the call is connected even when it is not, as in your cases. Rest assured that we are putting a lot of effort in detecting this so that we can report the issues to our providers and avoid charging you. In the meantime we kindly invite you to mail us at support@rebtel.com and give us the number registered to your Rebtel account, we will be glad to refund the calls that failed to connect and were charged to your account.

title: Be careful!
text: Hi there. I recently found out about rebtel and very quickly downloaded it  as an alternative to quite expansive italian rates for abroad calls. I needed sth cheap to stay in touch with my friends and family in Poland. However I found out the hard way that rebtel  fees and rates are not as clear as company want us to believe in. For example when you top up credit they charge extra tax to it. So for example a 20€ credit actually costs you 23€. But it's not all. According to the rebtel website a single minute to polish mobile phone should cost me 0,119€ but after a brief chat with my sister ( around 4 min) 1,5€ disappeared from my account. Connection itself isn't great either. So overall not sure if  Rebtel is such a great deal after all.  At least not for me!
answer: Hi there Agata, thanks for your comment. Very sorry to hear about your experience. With regards to the tax, this is not money that we get to keep. As an EU-based company, we're required by law to charge VAT on all payments made by EU residents. I see that you're based in the US, so you must have entered your Polish credit card details, as US residents aren't charged VAT. Also, minute rates to some Polish mobile phone providers differ in rates. We recommend to always have a thorough look through rates page of the country you intend to call. You can find the Polish rates page here http://www.rebtel.com/en/Cheap-Calls/Poland/

answer: Hi there Kaz, thanks for your comment. With regards to the tax, this is not money that we get to keep. As an EU-based company, we're required by law to charge VAT on all payments made by EU residents. I see that you're based in the US, which makes it strange that you've been charged VAT. To get to the bottom of this, please contact us directly on customerteam@rebtel.com so we can have a look at your account. Thanks, and sorry for the inconvenience.

text: I would be careful if you have an account with Rebtel in another country such as I do ,Best Wishes Anyway,Larry McCallum
answer: Hi Larry, I have noticed that the numbers that you registered with Rebtel isn't in the same account. It would be easier for you to have the numbers in the same account and change the preferred number. E,g. change to the Canadian number once in Canada and change to the number in Singapore when you are there. All your Rebtel numbers will change to local numbers in the country you're visiting. When you get back, simply change your preferred phone again and your numbers will change back to local numbers in your home country again.If you would like more help, then please describe your problem in more detail here or contact us at support@rebtel.com and write "attention trust pilot" as the subject.I hope this helps!Best regards,Rebtel Support

title: Call quality is good, but there are some serious issues otherwise
text: So far, Rebtel has locked me out of my account on two occasions.  Both times, I was unable to use the service or even log in to my online account.  When this happens, you must email them and wait for a reply.  There is no customer service number, email is the only method of communication.  In both cases, I was locked out due to a specific number they claimed I called.  I was told that number was in a block of numbers that they claim have been perpetrators of fraud on their service.  I have never called the number they claimed I called.  Hopefully their automatic fraud detection system will improve, as it is obviously quite buggy.  I'm sure they could have handled this better as well.  Other than that, the price is right and I haven't noticed any issues with the call quality.  The unfortunate issue I mentioned though required I have a backup service on standby as I wait for them to unlock my account.

title: Rebtel is doing great everywhere
text: I decided to try Rebtel service mainly to see if it could help those friends and relatives who are non-techie, and it did. Some phone services have hi-fi methods/plans which may be tough to implement by the common man.But Rebtel is simple, cheap and seems to be way better than conventional calling methods. Here the phone bell rings immediately as you dial the number, unlike other phone services which I have tried in this past. Though they charge a minimal price, yet the Call quality has been excellent so far.After I got accustomed to this service and was satisfied about the same, I encouraged my loved ones to register with Rebtel. My family in abroad has been using this since a year and even my relatives and friends who are dispersed across the globe. All of them are thankful to me for recommending Rebtel.The company offers you very reasonable international calls rates to various locations by assigning specific local phone numbers to your calls recipients in their countries. Rebtel also offers you the benefit of several freebies. You can call your friend and ask him to hang up for some time, and call you back while you stay on the line. You'll be connected and you get the ‘free’ call advantage of the international part. It may sound weird but trust me it works.Also, you get a trial 5-minutes phone call to any number and not to forget all calls between Rebtel members are free. However, to enjoy this freebie, your friend may not necessary be a Rebtel subscriber at all but both of you must be living in one of the 51 Rebtel countries.

title: Thats Why I Love Using Rebtel
text: For the next 36 months, my wife has been transferred to Manchester, UK. We have 2 kids, our son who is 8 years old and elder daughter who is 12 years old. Both the kids are very responsible and manage their activities on their own. We have tried several cheap international calling facilities, but none of them had good voice clarity, and surprisingly none of them turned out to be cheap as promised.Our neighbours recommended Rebtel. They had a lot to say about Rebtel and its cheap international calling plans. They were quite convincing and we too tried Rebtel. As a starter we got 5 minutes of free calling and since it was Easter week the call rates were further low than their normal rates. Our kids love this service and believe me the voice clarity is very good. Not to forget, Rebtel to Rebtel calling is free, so most of the times we are actually speaking free, unless we have to call some other number. Recently I got an e-newsletter from Rebtel, they serve more than 51 countries and every week they have some special offer.Its good to know how technology can help you save money. Thank you Rebtel.Pros - Cheap Rates, Good Service, Great Voice ClarityCons - Call drops on few occasions.

title: Rebtel, a well-programmed service
text: As a manufacturer in New York, I make several calls to Europe since my business runs there too.I use my mobile phone so much that I just can’t have the count of it but that hardly matters sinceRebtel gives me an affordable service.The functionality of Rebtel is really simple. My contact list is programmed into my phone andeach one has a unique phone number, and it’s great to ask the other person to call. Iwould suggest, if it’s going to be short calls then don’t ask for a call back, since the rates are wayaffordable.Let me not forget to mention about quality, since I am frequent international caller I tried severalcalling card which used to charge me a heavy price. Not only that, even the quality of the eachcall was way bad and the wait time for the ring was too long. The service would cause painrather than comfort. I used to get cut off so often that would disturb my business conversation.With Rebtel the call quality is crystal clear and it starts ringing right away.So if you want to save your money and make life easy, Go for Rebtel!Good: Ease to execute and great call qualityBad: None

title: Easy to use and cheap
text: I use Rebtel to call two of my best friends who lives in Rio and Oslo. I use the Android app, and it's so easy to use you almost can't believe it. But I'm really happy that I decided to use Rebtel instead. title: I was about to subscribe for their …
text: I was about to subscribe for their service.. But the reviews saved me.. Thank you all for helping me choose wisely..!!!
answer: Hi Gaurav,We’re sorry to hear you got discouraged to try our service, but we want to let you know than many of the comments are based on a communication misunderstanding due to confusions and those people who contacted us through our support team have been taken care of.Keep in mind that it is usually unhappy customers who comment. Happy users who enjoy the service and rarely voice their satisfaction on such a forum. According to our user satisfaction study 98% of our customer base is satisfied. We hope you decide to try so you can take your own conclusions!Regards,/Pilar.

title: Update:   Hello,   I got my credits back now. Thank you for that. I am a bit apprehensive of the fact that it was possible for my credits to disappear and only to re-appear when I raised a complaint.
text: I have only been with Rebtel for a few months when I was introduced to their services.  I have an auto top-up which means my account gets replenished monthly.  The last top-up was 08/06/2017 which was for 170minutes. I have used less than 50mins out this total.  However, today I tried to make a call but each time I get the message that there is another on- going call on my account. Now my credit has been exhausted! I believe my account has been compromised. I am cancelling my subscription immediately.You have fraudsters in your mix!Very sad!  NB: I sent the message above to your support, no reply as we speak!
answer: Dear Temi,Update: We're glad it got sorted! If you ever need help, you can always write to us at support@rebtel.com and we'll gladly help!I can see from your account that you still have 124 minutes left. You can check it at any time by logging in to your Rebtel account, also from "subscriptions" on your Rebtel app.We just replied to your private message #1200763 with some information about the reasons that could be generating this issue, please check your email and share with us the answers to our questions by replying to that email so we can figure out what´s going on and help you out. Thanks in advance!Best regards,/Pilar.

title: Iren Horvath
text: Hi My name Iren Horvath We  Rebtel join only 1 month For £7 pound every month But now every month £8:40 Gone I don't like Very bad experience with Rebtel
answer: Hi Iren,Rebtel charges VAT according to the country where you are using the service from. For example, if you are using the service from the UK, VAT will be charged at 20%, 19% from Germany and 21% from Spain. If you buy £7 world credit from the UK, you will pay £8,40 in total (£1,40 VAT).We are so sorry to hear that you had a bad experience with us, Could you please elaborate why did you say that? We would like to improve it.Please be so kind to email us at support@rebtel.com providing us with a detailed description of your experience so we can assist you in the best possible way. Thank you in advance!Regards,/Pilar.

title: VERY BAD EXPERIENCE WITH REBTEL........!!!!!!
text: Hi, My name is Neil Waters.I made a payment on my phone today (06/05/2017) and added the subscription to call India unlimited for $10 (US) and every time i try to make a call using the phone number it keeps on saying please enter the number and then my pin and beeps 4 times and call gets disconnected. On the app, under "CHOOSE YOUR CONNECTION", when i remove the PHONE LINES option, the call gets connected using WIFI or CELLULAR DATA, and the call reception is extremely bad and poor in quality........and the call drops frequently.I used to be able to call INDIA directly using the PHONE LINES connection on my cell phone and the call quality was good.....I did not have to use WIFI or CELLULAR DATA before.......What you guys can do is, refund me the $10 (US) and will re-do the subscription again online, maybe then the problem will be solved.I mailed you guys several time but you guys still haven't replied. Can you guys please contact me by call 16474570045My receipt no. : 1d415ed0-72a8-4317-a7c8-2c5c2f7a2646
answer: Dear Neil, I answered you yesterday through your previous request on Trust Pilot and on the ticket number #1193204.As we explained, the problem is that you are calling from a number with a hidden caller id or a number unknown to us, then you will need to enter your registered number and PIN number each time you make a call for the system to be able to recognize you.I could see that you have two different accounts with us, please make sure that you logged in to your app by entering the correct registered number on the account where you payed the product and that number should be the same as the one you have on your sim card for the system works as it is intended.Remember that if you are calling from a device without sim card you will not be able to connect your calls through "phone lines".We can continue assisting you from the ticket number #1193204, please check you email and send us the information we required to help you out. Thanks for your help and understanding!Regards,/Pilar.

title: Hello
text: Hello, i am writing this review regarding the auto top up which is switched on by it self many times, the last time you chaatged me 10$ from my account which it had no enough funds at that time so i got also overdraft chaarges of 35$ , please give me money back or i am going to stop using the app and claim a complain to my bank regarding this charges
answer: Dear Mohammed,We have updated your complaint number #1193919. I have double checked your account and I can see that the latest $10 USD payment was not a result of the auto recharge. Instead it was a payment made over the phone.Bear in mind that since your credit card is stored, you can credit your account through the voice operator.You are for example talking on the phone and your credit goes below 1 USD, you will hear the operator's voice telling you that credit is low and to please credit your account. If your credit card is stored on your account you will have the option to top up (by for example pressing the '*' key (for the main menu) and then the '3' key to add credit over the phone).We have refunded your remaining balance. The funds should be returned in 3-5 business days.We hope this clears things up!Best regards,/Pilar.

title: I have been using rebtel for a longtime …
text: I have been using rebtel for a longtime now. They have been charging me £10 and over instead of  $10. I have tried to contact them but no response. This is a rip off companyI need my refund for all the overpayment i have made since i joined rebtel. It is not just one transaction. Thank you
answer: Dear Abe Tan,We just replied to your private message. We can solve your problem there!I can see that one of my colleagues took care of you only one hour after you contacted us through the ticket number #1191553, we generally answer in 24h. Please understand that we have not been ignoring you and that we did our best to solve your problem.My colleague refunded the payment to you and disabled the auto recharge that you had enabled on 2017-05-07 with your last purchase. However the payment was made through the voice operator while you were talking on the phone and your credit goes below $1 USD, when you hear the operator's voice telling you that credit is low and to please credit your account by pressing the '*' key (for the main menu) and then the '3' key to add credit over the phone, and it was what happened.The currency on your account is US Dollar, you need to change it to the same as the one you have on your bank account (British pound GBP). To change your currency just log into your account at www.rebtel.com and click on your name. Click on "My Account", then on "My Profile" and make the change in the currency field. I have now made this for you, so you should not experience the same issue again.Best regards,/Pilar.
